meanings.definition: A person or animal that crawls.
meanings.sent1: The baby was one of the fastest crawlers in the playgroup.
meanings.sent2: The crawlers in the garden were searching for hidden treasures.
meanings.sent3: The race between the crawlers at the baby shower was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The crawlers in the marathon moved slowly but steadily towards the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The crawlers in the petting zoo were adorable and fluffy.

meanings.definition: A type of software that systematically browses the internet for the purpose of indexing web content.
meanings.sent1: The crawlers helped the search engine find new websites to list.
meanings.sent2: Web developers use crawlers to analyze website data efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The crawlers on the internet were like busy bees collecting information.
meanings.sent4: The crawlers worked tirelessly to map out the vast online world.
meanings.sent5: The crawlers explored the digital realm, uncovering hidden gems.

meanings.definition: A type of fishing lure that imitates a small creature moving along the bottom of a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman used a crawler to attract the attention of the fish.
meanings.sent2: Crawlers are popular among anglers for catching various fish species.
meanings.sent3: The crawler on the fishing line danced seductively in the water.
meanings.sent4: The crawler lure mimicked the movements of a real underwater critter.
meanings.sent5: The shiny crawler tempted the fish with its lifelike motion.
